description.narrative: Increased awareness and commitment by key decision makers, informants, opinion leaders and the general public to promote positive social norms, innovative approaches and action in the best interests of the child. Align with SDG agenda and ensure children are high on the policy agenda., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, country and government leaders, policymakers and decision-makers and other key stakeholders across society utilize robust knowledge and evidence to inform the development of equitable policies, programmes, public communication and advocacy to improve the situation of the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children and women.

sector.narrative: Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

title.narrative: China United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
China 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased awareness and commitment by key decision makers, informants, opinion leaders and the general public to promote positive social norms, innovative approaches and action in the best interests of the child. Align with SDG agenda and ensure children are high on the policy agenda.

description.narrative: UNICEF has explored innovative approaches such as livestreaming to continue the efforts in public communication and advocacy during COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of people reached through UNICEF platforms (social media, website and traditional media) to raise awareness and promote children

actual.value: 2019:6.2 million; includes about 5 million followers (cumulative) in total across nine social media channels (Weibo, WeChat, Douyin, Miaopai, Yizhibo, Youku, Toutiao, Tencent Weibo and Himalaya FM); and annual number of unique visitors to the website (about 1.2 million).
